member_organisations: Members of Stara Zagora Regional Economic Development Agency include the Municipality of Stara Zagora (a representative is holding the position of Chairman of SZREDA Board of Directors) and the municipalities Nikolaevo, Bratya Daskalovi, Gurkovo, Opan, Kazanlak and Radnevo, as well as the Trakia University, the Bulgarian-German Training Center of Stara Zagora, the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Stara Zagora, Stara Zagora Associations of Hoteliers and Restaurateurs.
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, International co-operation and development, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Youth, Regional Policy
organisation_name: Stara Zagora Regional Economic Development Agency (SZREDA)
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
subsection: Other public or mixed entities, created by law whose purpose is to act in the public interest
membership: SZREDA is a member of the Bulgarian Association of Regional Development Agencies and Business Centers (BARDA) and the regional representative of the Bulgarian Small and Medium Enterprises Promotion Agency, the Bulgarian Foreign Investment Agency and the Bulgarian Trade Promotion Agency.
relevant_communication:
SZREDA is a hosting structure of Europe Direct Information Center Stara Zagora. As such, we regularly organise events on EU policies (e.g. conferences, round tables, public debates) involving local stakeholders, academia and citizens. SZREDA is also publishing public consultations on its website along with other relevant information on EU policies. 
SZREDA has already organised a public debate on the White paper on the Future of Europe with local stakeholders and citizens. The debate was attended by Mr Ognian Zlatev, Head of the Representation of the European Commission in Bulgaria. 
SZREDA has also organised a series of events on the Investment Plan for Europe gathering together representatives from the business, local stakeholders, financial institutions which had agreements under the Investment Plan, representatives of European Investment Bank and Mr Ognian Zlatev, Head of the Representation of the European Commission in Bulgaria.
